item.title: Researchers Find That Frogs Can Quickly Increase Their Tolerance to Pesticides
item.description: Although there is a large body of research on pests evolving tolerances for the pesticides meant to destroy them, there have been considerably fewer studies on how non-target animals in these ecosystems may do the same. In recently-published research, Rensselaer’s Rick Relyea, Ph.D., professor of biological sciences and David M. Darrin ’40 Senior Endowed Chair, and his team have begun to address this gap in research.
item.author: Community

item.title: Former RPI Hockey Captain Named Head Coach of Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins
item.description: Former Rensselaer men’s hockey captain Kirk MacDonald ’07 has been named head coach of the Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins of the American Hockey League (AHL). MacDonald, who was most recently the head coach of the Dubuque Fighting Saints of the United States Hockey League (USHL) the past two seasons, played from 2003-2007 with the Engineers.

item.title: Print Server Maintenance Scheduled for Evening of July 18
item.description: From approximately 6:00PM to 9:00PM on Thursday, July 18, DotCIO staff will be performing maintenance on the campus printing environment. As a result, there will be a brief outage that will affect all print jobs sent from a large number of printers around the Rensselaer campus.

item.title: Nominations Being Sought for RAA Teaching Award
item.description: Nominations are now being accepted for the 2024 Rensselaer Alumni Association (RAA) Teaching Award, which recognizes current members of the faculty for their outstanding teaching techniques, contributions to the campus experience, and commitment to students. Nominations are due by Wednesday, July 31.

item.title: Training, Resources to Assist Faculty with Adding Questions to End-of-Term Evaluations
item.description: Summer I and III end-of-term course evaluations will be open to students August 1-17, with reports available to instructors on September 13; instructors have until July 31 to add questions to their courses using HelioCampus. The Office of Undergraduate Education will offer training; self-help information is available on the HelioCampus Resource Site.

item.title: MBA for Professionals Review Scheduled for July 24
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, July 24, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Participants will learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with real-world MBA experience, prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations, and engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential.
